instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3738: What is 820-3738? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> SMC Replaced now right fan not working
threads.message:
Hello,

Can an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> SMC be used to replace a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> SMC? I've just replace two different <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board ([URL="tel:<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>"]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL], [URL="tel:<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3738</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>"]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3738</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL]) smc due to no power, with ones taken from a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> boards. Now both <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> boards right fans aren't working. I've confirmed the below voltages are present.

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>

<SIGNAL>SMC_FAN_1_CTL</SIGNAL> voltage is at 0.0034V and not increasing.

Also performed resistance check and compared to the left side, both match. 

I swapped out the smc twice on one of the board with the same results (confirmed pads for fan control was good). 

Has anyone experienced this and what what did you find was the issue?

Thanks.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> SMC Replaced now right fan not working
threads.message: You need to use a SMC from the exact same donor board.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> SMC Replaced now right fan not working
threads.message: Thanks. That what i figured. Guess need to stock up on donor boards for the diff. models.
